optionalfeature.name: Acquired Tolerance
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws against being {@condition Poisoned|XPHB}, and you gain {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Poison damage. In addition, you automatically succeed on saving throws against your own Apothecary spells, and never take damage from your own Apothecary spells.

optionalfeature.name: Adrenaline Surge
entries: A creature at 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} who regains {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} from a spell you cast using an Apothecary spell slot gains {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to all damage and has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws until the end of its next turn. It gains {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on the first attack roll it makes on its next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Anatomical Precision
entries: When you make a weapon attack, you can use your Intelligence modifier, instead of Strength or Dexterity, for the attack and damage rolls.

optionalfeature.name: Anesthesiology
entries: You can cast {@spell Hold Person|XPHB} without expending a spell slot or requiring material components. You must finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} before you can use this Theory on the same creature again.

optionalfeature.name: Bedside Manner
entries: You gain {@variantrule Expertise|XPHB} in the {@skill Insight|XPHB} and {@skill Persuasion|XPHB} skills.

optionalfeature.name: Caustic Formulae
entries: Once per turn when you deal damage to a creature or object with an Apothecary spell, you can expend an Apothecary spell slot to deal {@damage 2d4} extra Acid damage to that target, plus another {@damage 2d4} per level of the spell slot.

optionalfeature.name: Clinical Conditioning
entries: You gain proficiency in Constitution saving throws.

optionalfeature.name: Combat Medic
entries: You gain proficiency with martial weapons and shields.

optionalfeature.name: Corrosive Compound
entries: When you deal Poison damage with your Apothecary spells, you can choose to deal half the spell's damage as Poison damage and half the spell's damage as Acid damage instead.

optionalfeature.name: Cosmetic Surgery
entries: You can spend 8 hours performing an occult surgical procedure upon a willing creature, permanently transforming its appearance. You decide what the creature looks like, including facial features, the sound of its voice, hair length, coloration, and distinguishing characteristics, but none of its game statistics change. You can't alter the size of a creature, and its basic shape stays the same. The resulting transformation is non-magical, however, a {@spell Greater Restoration|XPHB} spell or similar magic cast upon the creature can restore it to its original appearance.

optionalfeature.name: Critical Condition
entries: When a creature rolls a natural 1 on a saving throw made against one of your {@filter Apothecary spells that deals damage|spells|source=|class=apothecary (Dk:EE'24)|damage type=acid;bludgeoning;cold;fire;force;lightning;necrotic;piercing;poison;psychic;radiant;slashing;thunder|saving throw=strength;dexterity;constitution;intelligence;wisdom;charisma}, roll all of the spell's damage dice twice and add them together. Then add any relevant modifiers as normal to determine the damage that creature takes from the spell.

optionalfeature.name: Diagnosis
entries: You can take the {@action Help|XPHB} action as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} on your turn.

optionalfeature.name: Doctor's Note
entries: You can cast the {@spell Sending|XPHB} spell at-will. You must finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} before you can use this Theory to contact the same creature again.

optionalfeature.name: Double Dose
entries: When you cast an Apothecary spell using an {@filter Apothecary spell slot that targets a single creature and restores {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}|spells|source=|class=apothecary (Dk:EE'24)|components & miscellaneous=hl;!reprinted|area style=st} to that creature, you can target an additional creature within range.

optionalfeature.name: Extracurricular Research
entries: You learn two additional cantrips of your choice from any class's spell list. These cantrips become Apothecary cantrips for you.

optionalfeature.name: Inoculation
entries: You have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Necrotic damage, and your {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} maximum can't be reduced. In addition, you are {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB|Immune} to diseases.

optionalfeature.name: Interdisciplinary Practice
entries: When you use your action to cast a spell, you can make one weapon attack as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Laboratory Assistant
entries: You learn the spell {@spell Find Familiar|XPHB}, and always have this spell prepared. It doesn't count against the number of Apothecary spells you can prepare.

optionalfeature.name: Liability Insurance
entries: You can cast {@spell Contingency|XPHB} once on yourself without material components. You can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Medical Lexicon
entries: You learn six languages of your choice. You can cast {@spell Detect Poison and Disease|XPHB} at will.

optionalfeature.name: Nerve Agent
entries: When you deal Poison damage with your Apothecary spells, you can choose to deal Psychic damage instead.

optionalfeature.name: Noxious Blood
entries: When a creature hits you with a melee attack while within 5 feet of you, it takes Poison damage equal to {@damage 1d6} + your Constitution modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Pharmacology
entries: When you cast a spell using an Apothecary spell slot or your Greater Formula feature which restores {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} to a creature, the creature regains additional {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to your Intelligence modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Physiological Analysis
entries: If you spend at least 1 minute observing or interacting with another creature outside combat, you can learn certain information about its physiology. The Game Master reveals to you two of the following characteristics of your choice:
Alternatively, you can spend 1 minute observing a corpse. After 1 minute, you determine the cause of death.

optionalfeature.name: Practical Resuscitation
entries: When you cast a spell that has the sole effect of restoring a creature to life (but not undeath), such as {@spell Raise Dead|XPHB}, you don't need material components to cast the spell if the creature has died within the past hour.

optionalfeature.name: Putrefaction
entries: Your Apothecary spells and abilities ignore undead creatures' {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} or {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to Poison damage and {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition.

optionalfeature.name: Rapid Response
entries: When you cast an Apothecary spell that restores {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} to a creature, before or after casting the spell, you can move your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} without provoking {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB|Opportunity Attacks}.

optionalfeature.name: Routine Procedure
entries: You can cast {@spell Lesser Restoration|XPHB} at-will without expending a spell slot.

optionalfeature.name: Stolen Secrets
entries: You learn one spell from any class's spell list. It must be of a level for which you have Apothecary spell slots or lower. The spell is treated as an Apothecary spell for you, and doesn't count against the number of Apothecary spells you know.

optionalfeature.name: Subject Preparation
entries: When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, that creature has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on the next saving throw it makes against an Apothecary spell you cast before the end of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Surgeon's Instinct
entries: You have {@sense Blindsight|XPHB} out to a range of 10 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Surgical Strikes
entries: You can attack twice, instead of once, when you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action on your turn.

optionalfeature.name: Toxicology
entries: You add your Intelligence modifier to the damage rolls of spells that deal Poison damage.

optionalfeature.name: Triage
entries: You learn the {@spell Spare the Dying|XPHB} cantrip if you don't know it already. When you cast this cantrip, it has a range of 60 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Unfailing Focus
entries: When you fail a Constitution saving throw to maintain {@status Concentration|XPHB} on an Apothecary spell, you can choose to succeed instead. Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Venomous Instruments
entries: When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, the creature takes extra Poison damage equal to your Intelligence modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Virulence
entries: When you roll a 1 on a damage die for an Apothecary spell that deals Poison damage, you can reroll the die. You must use the new result, even if the new roll is a 1.

optionalfeature.name: Vital Signs
entries: When a creature you can see within 30 feet of you fails a saving throw or death saving throw, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to add your Intelligence modifier to the creature's roll, potentially turning a failure into a success. You must finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB} before you can use this Theory on the same creature again.

optionalfeature.name: Vivisection
entries: Your weapon attacks score a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB} on a 19 or 20.

spell.name: Acid Burn
entries: You magically produce a spray of acidic formula in a 15-foot {@variantrule Cone [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cone} in front of you. All creatures in the cone must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 1d6} Acid damage.
This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d6} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d6}), 11th level ({@dice 3d6}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d6}).

spell.name: Bacterial Barrage
entries: You attack a creature in range with a quick spreading infection that takes advantage of existing conditions. Make a ranged spell attack against a target, on a hit the infection does {@damage 1d8} Necrotic damage to the target. If the target is suffering from the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition or a disease, it instead takes {@damage 1d12} Necrotic damage.
The spell's damage increases by one die when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d8} or {@dice 2d12}), 11th level ({@dice 3d8} or {@dice 3d12}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d8} or {@dice 4d12}).

scalingLevelDice.label: Necrotic damage to Poisoned or diseased creature

spell.name: Poison Needle
entries: You launch a conjured dart coated with lethal poison at a creature you can see within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d10} Poison damage.

If the Poison damage reduces the target to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, the target is stable but {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} for 1 hour, even after regaining {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, and is {@condition Paralyzed|XPHB} while {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} in this way.
This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d10} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d10}), 11th level ({@dice 3d10}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d10}).

spell.name: Acrid Orb

components.m: a vial of stomach acid and a pinch of sulfate

entries: You create an orb of acid gel and fling it at one creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 2d6} Acid damage. Whether the attack hits or misses, the orb explodes. The target and each creature within 5 feet of it must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 2d6} Acid damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the exploding Acid damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Envenom

components.m: a vial of basic poison

entries: Choose a creature you can see within range to inflict with a magical poison. The target takes {@damage 2d4} Poison damage and must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed saving throw, it becomes {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} for the spell's duration.

While {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} in this way, the target must make a Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns. It takes {@damage 2d4} Poison damage on a failed saving throw. On a success, the spell ends on that target.
A {@spell Lesser Restoration|XPHB} spell cast on the target ends this spell early.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 1st

spell.name: Infect

components.m: a petri dish

entries: You inflict a creature you can see within range with a magical disease. At the start of each of the target's turns, it must make a Constitution saving throw. The creature takes {@damage 1d12} Necrotic damage on a failed saving throw, or half as much on a successful one. If a target succeeds on three of these saves, the spell ends.
A {@spell Lesser Restoration|XPHB} spell cast on the target ends this spell early.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d12} for every two slot levels above 1st.

spell.name: Stream of Consumption
entries: For the spell's duration, your tongue becomes an elongated tether of necrotic green energy you can use to drink the vitality of other creatures. One creature of your choice within 60 feet of you that you can see must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target gains 1 level of {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB}, and you regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to {@dice 1d4} + your spellcasting ability modifier.

On each of your turns until the spell ends, you can use your action to target the same creature or a different one, but can't target a creature again if it has succeeded on a saving throw against this casting of stream of consumption.

spell.name: Toxic Shield

components.m: a drop of dwarven blood

entries: You gain {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Poison damage and {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saves against being {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} for the duration. In addition, whenever a creature within 5 feet of you hits you with a melee attack, the shield sprays them with poison, dealing {@damage 1d8} Poison damage to the attacker.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the Poison damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for every 2 slot levels above 1st.

spell.name: Biohazard

components.m: a withered root and a drop of vinegar

entries: You coat a 15-foot-wide {@variantrule Cube [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cube} with toxic sludge for the spell's duration. The area is {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB} and filled with dangerous fumes. A creature that enters the area or starts its turn there must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed saving throw, the creature takes {@damage 1d8} Poison damage and is {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} until the start of its next turn. Creatures are affected even if they hold their breath or don't need to breathe.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 2nd

spell.name: Caustic Grip
entries: For the spell's duration, your hand secretes sticky burning acid which you can use to hold a creature in a painful clutch. When you cast this spell, and as a {@action Magic|XPHB} action on your turn until the spell ends, you can make a melee spell attack against one creature within 5 feet of you. On a hit, you deal {@damage 4d4} Acid damage to the target, and the creature is {@condition Restrained|XPHB} in your acidic grip until the end of your next turn. You can attack the same target round after round, or choose a new one at any time. If you switch targets, the prior target is no longer affected by the spell.

A creature {@condition Restrained|XPHB} by your grip can use its action to make a Strength check against your spell save DC. If it succeeds, it is no longer {@condition Restrained|XPHB}. Each time a creature ends its turn {@condition Restrained|XPHB} by this spell, it takes an additional {@damage 4d4} Acid damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 2d4} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Grasping Ghost

components.m: a finger bone and a scrap of fabric

entries: A flock of floating spectral hands appear and grasp a target you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Strength saving throw. A target takes {@damage 3d8} Necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

In addition, on a failed saving throw the ghostly hands grapple the target until the end of your next turn, and immediately move the target up to 30 feet in a direction of your choice (but not upward). On its turn, the creature can use an action to attempt to escape the grapple by making a Strength or Dexterity check (its choice) against your spell save DC. If it succeeds, the grapple ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the grasping ghost can target one additional creature within range for each spell level above 2nd.

spell.name: Invigorate

components.m: a syringe and a blood sample

entries: Choose up to three creatures within range. Each target gains 10 {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} increase by 5 for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Ocular Necrosis
entries: Make a ranged spell attack against a creature you can see in range. If you hit, you wrack the creature with a deadly toxin that causes their eyes to bleed. The creature takes {@damage 2d6} Necrotic damage and is {@condition Blinded|XPHB} until the end of your next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the Necrotic damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot above 2nd.

spell.name: Corrosive Blast

components.m: a vial of acid

entries: A spew of acrid chemicals erupts from your hands. Each creature in a 30-foot {@variantrule Cone [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cone} must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 10d4} Acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
The acid destroys any objects made of organic materials in the spell's area. A creature killed by this spell has its flesh entirely dissolved, leaving behind only a corroded skeleton.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the Acid damage increases by {@dice 2d4} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Fetid Blade

components.m: a drop of acid and a pinch of iron dust

entries: You coat a weapon you touch in an acidic substance. Until the spell ends, weapon attacks made with it deal an extra {@damage 2d4} Acid damage on a hit. If the weapon isn't already a magic weapon, it becomes one for the duration.

In addition, a creature hit with a melee attack using the weapon must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, it becomes {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} until the end of the attacker's next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the Acid damage increases by {@dice 1d4} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Pestilence

components.m: a withered flower

entries: You infect up to three creatures you can see within range with a magical disease. At the start of each of the target's turns, it must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed saving throw, the creature takes {@damage 3d6} Necrotic damage and gains 1 level of {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB}. If a target succeeds on three of these saves, the spell ends for that creature.
A {@spell Lesser Restoration|XPHB} spell cast on a target ends this spell early for that creature.

spell.name: Tranquilizing Toxin
entries: One target you choose within range must make a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 8d6} Poison damage and become {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} until the end of your next turn. While {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} in this way, the target is also {@condition Stunned|XPHB}. On a successful saving throw, the target takes half damage and is not {@condition Poisoned|XPHB}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the Poison damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Venomous Aura

components.m: scales or fangs of a venomous snake

entries: You emit a baleful aura which disorients creatures who approach you. Any creatures that start their turn within your 10 feet {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} are {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} until the start of their next turn.

spell.name: Blood Worm

components.m: a jar full of leeches

entries: You infect a creature you can see within range with a magical disease in the form of a malignant parasite. Once per turn when a creature hits the infected target with a weapon attack, that attack deals an additional {@damage 4d6} Necrotic damage, and the attacker regains {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the Necrotic damage dealt. Each time the infected target takes this Necrotic damage, it makes a Constitution saving throw against the spell. If the saving throw succeeds, the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the Necrotic damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Corpse Explosion

time.condition: which you take when a creature you can see dies within 120 feet of you.

entries: You cause the triggering creature's body to explode in a violent shower of gore and infected flesh. Creatures within 10 feet of a point centered on the triggering creature's body take {@damage 4d8} Necrotic damage and {@damage 4d8} Acid damage, or half as much damage on a successful Dexterity saving throw.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by {@damage 1d8} Acid damage for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Corrupting Spores

components.m: a dried mushroom

entries: A small patch of three poison mushrooms magically sprout in a 5-foot square that you can see within range. The mushrooms emit toxic spores, and any creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the mushroom patch must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 1d8} Poison damage for each mushroom in the patch and is {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} until the start of its next turn.
Until the spell ends, you can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} on your turn to cause an additional mushroom to sprout within the patch.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, one additional mushroom sprouts with the initial patch for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Last Rites

components.m: a small piece of brass, a rose petal, and a drop of holy water

entries: You target a creature you can see within range with a beam of holy light that shines down upon them. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw. The target takes {@damage 8d8} Radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. This spell has no effect on celestials or constructs.
If you target an undead or fiend, it makes the saving throw with {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB}, and the spell deals maximum damage to it.
If an undead or fiend is reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} by this spell, it dies and its body is reduced to ash.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, you may target an additional creature within 30 feet of each other for each spell level above 5th.

spell.name: Poison Wave

components.m: a withered root and a drop of vinegar

entries: A wave of poisonous fumes emanates from you. Creatures in a 30 feet {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} make a Constitution saving throw.

On a failed save, each creature takes {@damage 4d12} Poison damage and is {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} until the end of your next turn. On a successful saving throw, a creature takes half as much damage and does not become {@condition Poisoned|XPHB}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d12} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Summon the Thing with the Writhing Tail

components.m: a tuft of cat hair and a dead rat

entries: You call forth {@creature The Thing with the Writhing Tail|GuideDrakkenheim}. It manifests in an unoccupied space that you can see within range. This corporeal form uses the stat block below. The creature disappears when it drops to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} or when the spell ends.

The creature is an ally to you and your companions. In combat, the creature shares your {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} count, but it takes its turn immediately after yours. It obeys your verbal commands (no action required by you). If you don't issue any, it takes the {@action Dodge|XPHB} action and uses its move to avoid danger.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, use the higher level wherever the spell's level appears in the stat block.

spell.name: Vitriol Ichor

components.m: a vial of nitric acid and a flask of water

entries: Choose a creature within range that has natural armor or is wearing armor. You magically cause the creature's natural or manufactured armor to become corroded and brittle for the spell's duration. While its armor is corroded, the creature's AC becomes 10 + the creature's Dexterity modifier.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, you may target one additional creature for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Acid Rain

components.m: a pinch of sulfur and ground coal

entries: Until the spell ends, acid rain falls in a 40-foot-tall {@variantrule Cylinder [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cylinder} with a 40-foot radius centered on a point you choose within range. The area is {@variantrule Lightly Obscured|XPHB}, and exposed flames in the area are doused.

Chemical pools accumulate on the ground in the area, making it {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB}. When a creature enters the spell's area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it takes {@damage 3d6} Acid damage and must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, it falls {@condition Prone|XPHB} in the pools, taking an additional {@damage 3d6} Acid damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the Acid damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Nerve Gas

components.m: samples of phosphate and chlorine mixed with a drop of pure alcohol

entries: You create a 10-foot-radius {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere} of toxic fog centered on a point you choose within range. The fog spreads around corners.
It lasts for the duration or until strong wind disperses the fog, ending the spell. The fog's area is {@variantrule Heavily Obscured|XPHB}.

When a creature enters the spell's area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, that creature must make an Intelligence saving throw. On a failed saving throw, the creature takes {@damage 3d6} Psychic damage and becomes {@condition Stunned|XPHB} until the start of its next turn. On a successful saving throw, the creature takes half as much damage and is not {@condition Stunned|XPHB}. Creatures are affected even if they hold their breath or don't need to breathe.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage increases by {@damage 1d6} Psychic damage for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Septic Shock

components.m: a piece of a rotten liver

entries: Choose a creature you can see within range that doesn't have all its {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}. You infect the target's wounds with putrefying bacteria. The target must make a Constitution saving throw.

If it has less than half its maximum {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} remaining, it makes the saving throw with {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB}. On a failed save, the target takes {@damage 10d8} Necrotic damage and gains 1 level of {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB}. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage and does not gain any {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} levels.

spell.name: Toxic Barrage

components.m: Four death cap mushrooms

entries: You create four rays of pure poison and hurl them at targets within range. You can hurl them at one target or several.

Make a ranged spell attack for each ray. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 3d6} Poison damage. If a target is hit by one or more of these rays, it must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target is {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} for 1 minute. While {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} in this way, the target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns. On a success, it is no longer {@condition Poisoned|XPHB}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, you create one additional ray for each slot level above 5th

spell.name: Mephitic Vapors

components.m: a vial of chlorine

entries: You douse a 20-foot radius area centered on a point you can see within range with acrid slime, which remains for the spell's duration. The area becomes {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB}, and any creature wholly within the area is {@condition Blinded|XPHB} and can't take {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB|Reactions}.

A creature who starts its turn in the area must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 2d8} Poison damage and {@damage 2d8} Acid damage and gain one level of {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the damage increases by {@damage 1d8} Poison damage and {@damage 1d8} Acid damage for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Vile Necrosis

components.m: a vial of coagulated blood

entries: You point your finger towards a creature within range, projecting a pale green beam of debilitating energy at them.
Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 12d6} Necrotic damage, and it becomes {@condition Weakened|MonstersOfDrakkenheim}.
A {@condition Weakened|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} target can make a Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns. On a successful save, the weakness ends.

spell.name: Contamination Immunity

m.text: an eldritch lily mixed into 250 gp worth of purified fluids per target, which the spell consumes

entries: Until the spell ends, one willing creature you touch is {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB|Immune} to Necrotic damage and cannot gain {@condition Contamination|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} levels. The affected creature may rest normally within the Haze.
This spell ends immediately if the creature casts a contaminated spell.

entries.name: Researching the Spell:
entries: A character who can cast 7th level spells, knows the {@spell Neutralizing Field|CommunityDrakkenheim} spell, and who has visited the Delerium Heart can research contamination immunity.

spell.name: Grievous Wounds

components.m: a needle and several stitches

entries: Choose a creature you can see within range. You momentarily strip the target's physiology of all resilience, enough that a mere scratch can become a terrible injury. Until the end of your next turn, the target loses any damage {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB|Resistances} or {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB|Immunities}, becomes {@variantrule Vulnerability|XPHB|vulnerable} to all damage, and makes all its saving throws with {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB}.

spell.name: Miasma

components.m: a freshly harvested corpse lily

entries: You create a wall of sickly, yellowish green, toxic fumes on a solid surface within range. You can make the wall up to 60 feet long, 20 feet high, and 1 foot thick, or a ringed wall up to 20 feet in diameter, 20 feet high, and 1 foot thick. The wall is opaque and lasts for the duration.
When the wall appears, each creature within its area must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 10d4} acid damage, or half as much damage on a successful save.

One side of the wall, selected by you when you cast this spell, emits toxic fumes. It deals {@damage 8d8} Poison damage to each creature that ends its turn within 30 feet of that side or inside the wall. A creature takes the same damage when it enters the wall for the first time on a turn. The other side of the wall deals no damage.
A creature who takes Poison damage from the wall must make a Constitution saving throw or become {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} for the duration of the spell

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 2d8} for each slot level above 7th.

spell.name: Pandemic

components.m: the fetid corpse of a plague rat

entries: You infect one creature you can see within range with a deadly and highly infectious disease which lasts until it is cured by {@spell Greater Restoration|XPHB}, {@spell Heal|XPHB} or {@spell Wish}. Other spells and magical effects which remove diseases fail to cure the infection caused by this spell.

While infected, a creature must make a Constitution saving throw at the start of each of its turns. On a failed saving throw, it takes {@damage 10d8} Necrotic damage and becomes {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} until the start of its next turn. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage and is not {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB}. An infected creature must make the saving throw at the start of each of its turns until it dies or is cured.
A creature who starts its turn within 10 feet of a creature infected by this spell must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed saving throw, that creature contracts the infection.
When you cast the spell, you can choose yourself and up to eight other creatures to be unaffected by the infection caused by this casting of the spell.

spell.name: Touch of Death

components.m: the finger of a hag

entries: Make a melee spell attack against a target within 5 feet of you. On a hit, the target takes 200 Poison damage. This damage ignores any {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} or {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} the creature has to Poison damage, and can't be reduced or prevented in any way.

The potent poison lingers in the targets body and pulls it towards death. A target reduced to zero {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} by this Poison damage automatically fails {@variantrule Death Saving Throw|XPHB|Death Saving Throws} until it finishes a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. A {@spell Heal|XPHB} or {@spell Greater Restoration|XPHB} spell cast on the target also ends this effect.

spell.name: Breath of Nightshade

components.m: A pair of deadly nightshade flowers

entries: You exhale a 60-foot {@variantrule Cone [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cone} of lethal poison. Each creature in the area when you cast the spell must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature becomes {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} for 1 hour. While {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} by this spell, the creature is {@condition Paralyzed|XPHB}.
The spell ends for an affected creature if it takes any damage.

spell.name: Plague Wind

components.m: mucus from a ghoul

entries: You summon a roiling wind of flesh devouring disease and excruciating blood boiling fumes that sweeps over the area emanating from you in a 120-foot {@variantrule Cone [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cone}. Creatures in the area must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed saving throw a creature takes {@damage 5d8} Poison damage and {@damage 5d8} Necrotic damage or half as much damage on a success. After taking this damage, any affected creature with 25 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} or fewer remaining immediately dies and is reduced to a weathered skeleton as their flesh and soft tissue blows off like ash.

spell.name: Neutralizing Field

m.text: A delerium crystal or holy relic worth 1,000 gp

entries: You negate contaminated magical energies in a 10-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation}. Creatures in the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} (including you) can't gain {@condition Contamination|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} levels and have {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to Necrotic damage. Contaminated spells can't be cast by creatures in the area.

entries.name: Researching the Spell:
entries: A character who can cast 5th level spells, knows the {@spell Purge Contamination|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} spell, and has created at least 1 dose of {@item Aqua Expurgo|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} may research neutralizing field.

spell.name: Comet Shards

components.m: a delerium chip worth 10 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: {@i When you cast this spell, you gain 1 {@condition Contamination|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} level.}

You shatter the delerium fragment in your hand into three glowing comet-like motes of magical force which you hurl at your foes. Each comet hits a creature of your choice that you can see within range. A comet deals {@damage 2d4} + your spellcasting ability modifier Force damage to its target and pushes it 10 feet away from you. The comets all strike simultaneously, and you can direct them to hit one creature or several.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the spell creates one more comet for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Corrupted Cure

components.m: a delerium chip worth 10 gp

entries: {@i When you cast this spell, you gain 1 {@condition Contamination|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} level.}

A creature of your choice that you can see within range regains {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to {@dice 4d6} + your spellcasting ability modifier. This spell has no effect on undead or constructs.

When you cast this spell, the target can choose to gain a {@condition Contamination|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} level as well. If it does, it instead regains {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to {@dice 8d6} + your spellcasting ability modifier.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the healing increases by {@dice 2d6} for each slot level above 1st, or {@dice 4d6} if the target chooses to gain a {@condition Contamination|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} level.

spell.name: Controlled Mutation

components.m: a delerium chip worth 100gp

entries: {@i When you cast this spell, you gain 1 {@condition Contamination|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} level.}
You weave contaminated energy to temporarily imbue a creature within range with a beneficial mutation. Choose one of the following effects; the target gains that effect until the spell ends.

items.name: Dizziness
entries: The target can't take {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB|Reactions}.

items.name: Strength
entries: The target has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Strength attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws. The target can choose to gain a {@condition Contamination|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} level. If it does, its melee weapon attacks deal an additional {@damage 2d6} Necrotic damage for the spell's duration.

items.name: Constitution
entries: The target has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Constitution checks and saving throws. The target can choose to gain a {@condition Contamination|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} level. If it does, it gains {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage for the spell's duration.

items.name: Dexterity
entries: The target has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Dexterity attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws. The target can choose to gain a {@condition Contamination|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} level. If it does, its attacks with ranged and {@itemProperty F|XPHB|Finesse} weapons score a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB} on an 18-20 for the spell's duration.

items.name: Intelligence
entries: The target has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Intelligence ability checks and saving throws, as well as spell attack rolls. The target can also choose to gain a {@condition Contamination|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} level. If it does, for the duration of this spell, while the target is {@status Concentration|XPHB|Concentrating} on a spell it has cast, it's {@status Concentration|XPHB} can't be broken as a result of taking damage.

items.name: Wisdom
entries: The target has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Wisdom ability checks and saving throws, as well as spell attack rolls. The target can also choose to gain a {@condition Contamination|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} level. If it does, for the duration of this spell, it gains {@sense Blindsight|XPHB} to a range of 60 feet and can't be {@status Surprised|XPHB} while it is conscious.

items.name: Charisma
entries: The target has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Charisma ability checks and saving throws, as well as spell attack rolls. In addition, the target can choose to gain a {@condition Contamination|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} level. If it does, for the duration of this spell, when the target makes a Charisma ({@skill Persuasion|XPHB}) or Charisma ({@skill Deception|XPHB}) check, it can treat a d20 roll of 9 or lower as a 10.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can choose one additional effect for every two slot levels above 2nd.

spell.name: Vanish to the Space Between Worlds

time.condition: which you take when you take damage

components.m: a delerium chip worth 10 gp

entries: {@i When you cast this spell, you gain 1 {@condition Contamination|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} level.}

When you cast this spell, you vanish from your current plane of existence and appear in the Space Between Worlds (avoiding the triggering damage). At the start of your next turn, you return to an unoccupied space of your choice within 30 feet of the space you vanished from. If no unoccupied space is available within that range, you appear in the nearest unoccupied space (chosen at random if more than one space is equally near).

While within the Space Between Worlds, you can see and hear the plane you originated from, which is cast as a roiling blur, and you can't see anything there more than 60 feet away. You can only affect and be affected by other creatures in the Space Between Worlds. Creatures that aren't there can't perceive you or interact with you, unless they have the ability to do so.

spell.name: Weave the Elder Sign

components.m: a delerium chip worth 10gp, which the spell consumes

entries: {@i When you cast this spell, you gain 1 {@condition Contamination|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} level.}

You weave an impossible sign from an inscrutable reality in the air inside a 30-foot {@variantrule Cube [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cube} within range. It appears for only a moment before vanishing. Each creature in the area who sees the sign must make an Intelligence saving throw. On a failed saving throw, the creature becomes {@condition Blinded|XPHB} and {@condition Stunned|XPHB} for the spell's duration. On a successful saving throw, a creature is {@condition Blinded|XPHB} until the end of your next turn.

The spell ends for a {@condition Stunned|XPHB} creature if it takes any damage, or if someone else uses an action to shake the creature out of its stupor. When the spell ends for a {@condition Stunned|XPHB} creature, it takes {@damage 3d6} Psychic damage.

spell.name: Horrific Transformation

components.m: see description

entries: {@i When you cast this spell, you gain 1 {@condition Contamination|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} level.}

This spell transforms a willing creature that you touch into a horrific monstrosity. The spell has no effect on a shapechanger or a creature with 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}. The transformation lasts for the duration, or until the target drops to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} or dies.
The new form can be an {@filter aberration with a Challenge Rating of 4 or lower|bestiary|source=|Challenge Rating=[&0;&4]|type=aberration}.
The target's game statistics, including mental ability scores, are replaced by the statistics of the chosen aberration. It retains its alignment and personality.

The target assumes the {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} of its new form. When it reverts to its normal form, the creature returns to the number of {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} it had before it transformed. If it reverts as a result of dropping to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, any excess damage carries over to its normal form. As long as the excess damage doesn't reduce the creature's normal form to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, it isn't knocked {@condition Unconscious|XPHB}.
The creature is limited in the actions it can perform by the nature of its new form, and it can't speak, cast spells, or take any other action that requires hands or speech.
The target's gear melds into the new form. The creature can't activate, use, wield, or otherwise benefit from any of its equipment.

In addition to a delerium fragment worth 100gp, you must provide either the heart or brain (or equivalent organ in the case of aberrations with a truly alien physiology) taken from a creature of the same type: the organ must either be recently harvested or magically preserved via {@spell Gentle Repose|XPHB} or similar magic. As part of casting the spell, you drive the delerium fragment into the organ, and both are consumed by the spell. The Game Master determines if an aberration's physiology makes its organs suitable for use with this spell.

spell.name: Siphon Time

components.m: a broken clock, and a delerium fragment worth 100gp, which the spell consumes

entries: {@i When you cast this spell, you gain 1 {@condition Contamination|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} level.}

You seize upon the flow of time around up to three creatures of your choice within range, drawing seconds from them to use them yourself. Each target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be affected by this spell for the duration.

An affected target can't take {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB|Reactions}. On its turn, it must choose to either move, take an action, or a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}: a target can do only one of the three.
A creature affected by this spell can spend its action to try to pull back the threads of time. If it does, it can make another Wisdom saving throw. On a successful save, the effect ends for it.

While at least one other creature is affected by this spell, you gain an additional action on each of your turns. That action can be used only to take the {@action Attack|XPHB} (one weapon attack only), {@action Magic|XPHB}, {@action Dash|XPHB}, {@action Disengage|XPHB}, {@action Hide|XPHB}, or {@action Utilize|XPHB} action. If you use take the {@action Magic|XPHB} action, that spell must be a cantrip with a casting time of one action.

spell.name: Summon Delerium Elemental

components.m: a delerium fragment worth 100 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: {@i When you cast this spell, you gain 1 {@condition Contamination|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} level.}

You call forth a {@creature Delerium Elemental|GuideDrakkenheim|contaminated elemental} to do your bidding. Choose air, earth, fire, or water. Eldritch energy conjures a contaminated elemental of the chosen type, which appears in an unoccupied space within range: either an animated sludge (water), entropic flame (fire), living haze (air), or walking geode (earth). Each uses the summoned delerium elemental stat block below, but gains different traits based on the chosen element used to conjure the elemental. The elemental disappears when it drops to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} or when the spell ends.

The elemental is friendly to you and your companions for the duration of the spell. In combat, the creature shares your {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} count, but it takes its turn immediately after yours. It obeys any verbal command you give it (no action required by you). If you don't give any commands, it attacks the closest hostile creature it can see, moving towards it by the most direct route.

The elemental doesn't disappear if you lose {@status Concentration|XPHB} on this spell. Instead, you lose control of the elemental, it becomes hostile toward you and your companions, and it attacks you. An uncontrolled elemental can't be dismissed by you, and it remains until it is destroyed.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, use the higher level wherever the spell's level appears in the stat block.

spell.name: Contaminated Hands

components.m: a delerium fragment worth 100gp, which the spell consumes

entries: {@i When you cast this spell, you gain 1 {@condition Contamination|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} level.}

You create two Large hands of shimmering, octarine force in an unoccupied space that you can see within range. The hands last for the spell's duration. Both hands move at your command, mimicking the movements of your own hands.

Each hand is an object that has AC 20 and {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to your Hit Point maximum. If one or both of the hands drop to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, the spell ends. Each hand has a Strength of 26 (+8) and a Dexterity of 10 (+0) and occupies its space.

When you cast the spell, and as an action on your subsequent turns, you can move the hands up to 60 feet and then cause one of the following effects with each. Both hands can perform the same action, or different ones. The two hands must move to remain within 30 feet of each other.

items.name: Arcane Slam
entries: The hand strikes one creature or object within 5 feet of it. Make a melee spell attack for the hand using your game statistics. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 4d12} Necrotic damage. If you direct both hands to attack the same target, they gain {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on the attack roll.

items.name: Forceful Throw
entries: The hand attempts to push a creature within 5 feet of it in a direction you choose. Make a check with the hand's Strength contested by the Strength ({@skill Athletics|XPHB}) check of the target. If the target is Medium or smaller, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on the check. If you succeed, the hand pushes the target up to 5 feet plus a number of feet equal to five times your spellcasting ability modifier. The hand moves with the target to remain within 5 feet of it. If both hands are used against the same target, you can throw them ten times your spellcasting ability modifier, and gain {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on the check against a Large or smaller target.

items.name: Eldritch Grip
entries: The hand attempts to grapple a Huge or smaller creature within 5 feet of it. You use the hand's Strength score to resolve the grapple. If the target is Medium or smaller, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on the check. If both the hands are used against the same target, they can grapple a creature regardless of its size, and you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on the grapple check against a Large or smaller target.

items.name: Contaminated Crush
entries: You can have a hand crush a target it is grappling. When you do so, the target takes Bludgeoning damage equal to {@damage 2d12} + your spellcasting ability modifier. In addition, the target must make a Constitution saving throw or gain 1 {@condition Contamination|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} level. If both the hands are grappling the same target, you can have them rip the grappled target limb from limb. They deal an extra {@damage 4d12} necrotic damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage from the arcane slam and contaminated crush options increases by {@damage 2d12} and the damage from the eldritch grip increases by {@damage 2d6} for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Storm of Contamination

components.m: a delerium fragment worth 100 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: {@i When you cast this spell, you gain 1 {@condition Contamination|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} level.}

You create an arcing bolt of eldritch lightning that strikes a target of your choice that you can see within range. Multiple bolts then leap from that target to up to five other targets, each of which must be within 30 feet of the first target. A target can be a creature or an object and can be targeted by only one of the bolts.

A target must make a Dexterity saving throw. The target takes {@damage 10d12} Lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. In addition, a target which fails the saving throw gains 1 {@condition Contamination|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} level.

spell.name: Octarine Sword

components.m: a delerium fragment worth 100gp, and a dagger

entries: {@i When you cast this spell, you gain 1 {@condition Contamination|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} level.}
You create a sword-shaped plane of contaminated energy that hovers within range. It lasts for the duration or until you cast this spell again.

When the sword appears, you make a melee spell attack against a target of your choice within 5 feet of the sword. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 4d10} Force damage, and the target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes an additional {@damage 4d6} Necrotic damage and gains 1 {@condition Contamination|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} level.

Until the spell ends, you can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} on each of your turns to move the sword up to 30 feet to a spot you can see and repeat this attack against the same target or a different one.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th level or higher, the Force damage increases by {@damage 1d10} and the Necrotic damage increases by {@damage 1d6} for each slot level above 7th.

spell.name: Unbind Gravity

components.m: a delerium fragment worth 100gp, which the spell consumes

entries: {@i When you cast this spell, you gain 1 {@condition Contamination|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} level.}

This spell allows you to control gravity in a 100-foot {@variantrule Cube [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cube} centered on a point within range. When you cast this spell and at the start of each of your turns for the spell's duration, you decide which direction gravity pulls within the area. All creatures and objects that aren't somehow anchored to the ground in the area fall in the direction you choose until they reach the edge of the area. A creature can make a Dexterity saving throw to grab onto a fixed object it can reach, thus avoiding the fall.

If some solid object (such as a ceiling) is encountered in this fall, falling objects and creatures strike it just as they would during a normal downward fall. If an object or creature reaches the edge of the area without striking anything, it remains there, oscillating slightly, for the duration.

Alternatively, you can decide to prevent gravity from acting within the area. When you do, creatures within the area levitate in midair, and must move by pushing or pulling against a fixed object or surface within reach (such as a wall or a ceiling), which allows them to move as if they were climbing. Unattended objects float around randomly.
At the end of the duration, affected objects and creatures fall back down.

spell.name: Banish to the Space Between Worlds

components.m: a delerium fragment worth 100gp, which the spell consumes

entries: {@i When you cast this spell, you gain 1 {@condition Contamination|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} level.}

You banish a creature that you can see within range into the Space Between Worlds. Upon this roiling plane of chaotic potential, the target wanders incomprehensible vistas searching for a way back via strange and absurd exits. The target remains there for the duration or until it escapes.

The target can use its action to attempt to escape. When it does so, it makes an Intelligence check against your spell save DC. If it succeeds, it escapes, and the spell ends. On a failed check, the target takes {@damage 4d6} Psychic damage.
When the spell ends, the target reappears in the space it left or, if that space is occupied, in the nearest unoccupied space.

Time passes differently for the target within the Space Between Worlds, and it perceives its time spent there as having lasted hundreds or perhaps thousands of years, even if it was only gone for rounds or minutes in the mortal world.
A creature which dies in the Space Between Worlds does not return.

spell.name: Delerium Meteor Swarm

components.m: an igneous rock and a delerium fragment worth 100gp, which the spell consumes

entries: {@i When you cast this spell, you gain 1 {@condition Contamination|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} level.}

You call down eldritch falling stars that crash into the earth at four points you can see within range. Each creature within a 40-foot-radius {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere} centered on each point you choose must make a Dexterity saving throw. The sphere spreads around corners. A creature takes {@damage 10d6} Radiant damage, {@damage 10d6} Necrotic damage, {@damage 10d6} Thunder damage, {@damage 10d6} Psychic damage, and {@damage 10d6} Force damage on a failed saving throw, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature in the area of more than one burst is affected only once.

The falling stars leave lasting contamination in the areas they affect, which lasts for one hour. A creature that starts its turn within the affected area must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed saving throw, the creature takes {@damage 5d6} Necrotic damage and gains 1 {@condition Contamination|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} level. It takes half as much damage and does not gain any {@condition Contamination|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} levels on a successful save. A creature reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} by this damage immediately undergoes a Monstrous Transformation as if they had gained 6 {@condition Contamination|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} levels.
The spell damages structures and objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried.

background.name: Continental Nobility
entries: {@homebrew The original background feature was removed in favor of an Origin feat of your choice due to backgrounds no longer having a feature in 2024 rules.}

items.name: Requirements:
items.entry: Any class except {@class Sorcerer|XPHB}, {@class Warlock|XPHB}, or {@class Wizard|XPHB}

items.name: Ability Scores:
items.entry: Increase one of your starting ability scores by 2 and another by 1, or increase three scores by 1 each.

items.name: Skill Proficiencies:
items.entry: Choose two of your choice from the following list: {@skill Arcana|XPHB}, {@skill History|XPHB}, {@skill Religion|XPHB}, {@skill Nature|XPHB}

items.name: Equipment:
items.entry: Choose A or B: (A) A {@item Signet Ring|PHB} or brooch bearing your family crest, a cape in the colours of your house, a set of {@item Fine Clothes|XPHB}, 25 GP; or (B) 50 GP

backgroundFluff.name: Continental Nobility
entries: You are the scion of a noble household. Whether you hail from Caspia, Elyria, or Westemr, the fall of Drakkenheim has either adversely impacted your family's fortunes, or created a tantalizing opportunity to increase your political power and influence.

rows: I was well celebrated in my city as a slayer of a great troll.
I witnessed the death of my family during the civil war. They were targets for their ties to the von Kessel name.
I led my knights to victory in defending our castle during a raid in the war.
I lost a lot of good soldiers in an earlier expedition into Drakkenheim. We never made it past the gate.
My house was an enemy of the von Kessel family and had many battles with them.
I broke ties with my family when they folded to the Silver Order.
I am related, not to a king or queen, but to a noble figure who sat in the small council and made important decisions for their represented house.
My family lost everything in the destruction of Drakkenheim. We are noble only in name, no longer in standing.
